entry.title: Hashashin (The Assassins from the Ismaili Sect or The guys on whom the Assassins Creed game is based on)
entry.content:
The word "assassin" is actually derived from the Hashashin, and because of them, this word came into existence.

They were Isma'il Nizari Shia, the followers of Hasan Sabbah. That group was founded in Alamut before the start of the 11th century. Even during the time of Saladin Ayubi (rh), they tried to hold him back at times.

I have read a saying of Marco Polo about these Hashashin:

"The Old Man of the Mountain ruled his followers with a cunning unmatched in all the lands, by drugging them and promising them paradise. Then the Old Man of the Mountain would bring his young men into a paradise of beautiful gardens, flowing wine, and enchanting maidens, convincing them it was heaven. They were promised a return to this paradise if they carried out his orders, and killing themselves for him was his way of telling them that they would go to this paradise forever."

"They were taught to obey unquestioningly and to believe that death was but a small price to pay for the eternal reward."

They often used to kill themselves if they ever got into trouble or got caught.

"Their belief was such that they were willing to sacrifice their lives with joy for their religion, without hesitation or fear."

(The Damascus Chronicle of the Crusades.)

Ibn al-Athir:

"They were masters of deception, mingling with their targets and awaiting the moment when vigilance was least, striking fearlessly even if death was certain."

(al-Kamil fi al-Tarikh).

Bernard Lewis:

"The Assassins (Hashashin) were the first group in recorded history to use assassination as a systematic and organized tool of policy."

(The Assassins: A Radical Sect in Islam.)

Their influence or impact on the Islamic world was quite horrible, as they were causing chaos. Even Hulegu Khan said after conquering Alamut that they had ended the wolves of the mountains, who did nothing but create chaos in the land.

They mostly supported the Crusaders and were always against the Sunni rulers and Sunni Islam. They really hated Sunnis and often killed Sunnis, and they also killed Nazim-ul-Mulk, a minister of the Seljuks. There is even a letter from the founder of the Hashashin to that minister:

"I am surrounded by mountains, and with God’s help, I am in no need of your protection. Be content with your empire and leave me to govern my stronghold."

(I have read this in many Persian chronicles.)

Al-Juwayni:

"The Assassins (Hashashin) were like the shadow of fear."

Rashid al-Din:

"The Hashashin knew they could not face armies in open battle, so they devised another way to fight. By killing the commanders, the generals, and the viziers, they disrupted the entire machinery of war. A single blade from them was more effective than a thousand swords on the battlefield."

(Jami' al-Tawarikh)

Ibn al-Athir:

"These people were like no other. They would enter the courts of kings and governors, dressed as ordinary people, and wait for months, sometimes years, to accomplish their mission. They struck when least expected, even in the most heavily guarded places. This created a fear so widespread that no ruler felt secure on his throne. Even Nizam al-Mulk fell victim to their daggers, causing disarray in the administration of the empire."

Al-Juwayni:

"Their leaders claimed to follow a hidden Imam and justified their killings as divine justice. They would say, 'It is not for men to question the will of the Imam.' But to the rest of Islam, they were an abomination, striking fear and mistrust wherever they went."

Ibn al-Athir:

"While the Franks (Crusaders) advanced, spreading destruction among the lands of Islam, the Assassins struck not at the invaders but at the leaders of the Muslims. Their blades found the throats of viziers, emirs, and generals who had risen to defend the faith. Such actions served only the enemies of Islam."

(al-Kamil fi al-Tarikh)

William of Tyre:

"The Assassins, though Muslims themselves, did not hesitate to strike deals with the Christian lords. Their enmity toward the Seljuks was greater than their devotion to their faith, and they sought allies wherever they could find them, even among the enemies of Islam."

(History of Deeds)

They were basically the enemies of Islam in a way; they even killed those who wanted to unite the Muslims. They did nothing good for us, and the rulers, even after the Mongol invasion of Alamut, still feared that they were not completely safe, as these guys made them fear, as they would even get inside castles anywhere just to kill someone.

And this game, Assassins Creed, is also based upon them, and because of their actions, they made a game about these guys.

link.title: Hashashin (The Assassins from the Ismaili Sect or The guys on whom the Assassins Creed game is based on)

entry.title: Difference between Akbar and Sultan Aurangzeb
entry.content:
Vincent Smith in Akbar the Great Mogul: “Din-i-Ilahi never succeeded in winning mass acceptance, nor was it a religion in the traditional sense, it was never a religiion thats a misconception. It was more an expression of Akbar’s eclectic personality.”

Badayuni, wrote in Muntakhab-ut-Tawarikh:
“Akbar encouraged the Hindus to practice their customs openly which was fine, and he showed disregard for the Sharia, which caused great unrest among orthodox Muslims.”

Stanley Lane-Poole in Medieval India:
“Akbar’s Rajput marriages, while presented as acts of tolerance, were pragmatic moves to secure loyalty from powerful Hindu clans. These alliances were strategic, not necessarily driven by liberalism.”

Vincent Smith:
“Although Akbar’s policies were revolutionary for his time, they planted seeds of division within the empire. Orthodox Muslims viewed his secular approach as a betrayal of Islamic governance.”

In Ain-i-Akbari: “His Majesty abolished the tax (jizya) on non-Muslims, as he believed that all subjects of the empire, regardless of their faith, deserved to be treated with equity and justice.”

And during the rule of Akbar the hindus had so much influence within the kingdom that it was getting hard for a Muslim to even practice his own religion even when the Kingdom was full of Muslim rulers.

Jadunath Sarkar (History of Aurangzib):
“Aurangzeb, by his sheer strength of will and military brilliance, succeeded in extending the frontiers of the empire to their farthest limits.”
(Mughal Empire reached its best stage ever during the rule of Aurangzeb and he was spreading Islam aswell).

Niccolao Manucci, wrote:
“Aurangzeb lived simply, wore plain clothes, and earned his living by copying the Quran, setting an example for his court.”

Satish Chandra in Medieval India: “The reimposition of jizya by Aurangzeb was less about financial gain and more about asserting Islamic orthodoxy in governance, which alienated many of his non-Muslim subjects.”
Stanley Lane-Poole in Aurangzeb and the Decay of the Mughal Empire: “The jizya tax, though a symbolic gesture of orthodoxy, became a rallying cry for opposition to Mughal rule.”

Destruction of Temples:Audrey Truschke in Aurangzeb: The Life and Legacy of India’s Most Controversial King (2017):
“Aurangzeb’s temple destructions were often motivated by political considerations rather than religious zeal, targeting those temples linked to rebellious groups.”

Ottoman Sultan Mehmed IV praised Aurangzeb in a Letter, called him as:

“A mighty ruler and protector of Islam in the East.”

And Sultan Aurangzeb Alamgir (rh) even had the Sahada written in his armor or the armor vest which he used to wear before going to fight wars.

And we can say that he was without doubt the Greatest Mughal Sultan and the only one who was serious about spreading his Religion and had no care for the power or the throne only.

link.title: Difference between Akbar and Sultan Aurangzeb

entry.title: The Miraculous Verses of the Holy Quran, for which even contemporary (Modern) science cannot offer an explanation for.
entry.content:
Quran (Surah At-Talaq) 65:12:

"It is Allah who created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. His command descends among them so you may know that Allah is over all things competent, and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge."

The Words here are mentioned 'the likes of the earth and the heavens meaning different realms or dimensions within the Earth'.

We know that the previous tafsirs of this Ayah were limited to the knowledge of people as they didn't had access to current level of science and through modern science we can look for some possible meanings of this verse like is this about the multi-verse?

For example: String Theory:

String theory is the idea that the fundamental building blocks of the universe are not point-like particles, but tiny, vibrating strings of energy. These strings can vibrate at different frequencies, and their vibrations determine the properties of particles, like mass and charge. Essentially, the universe is like a cosmic symphony played on these strings. And its like that this world has some key points and dimensions which we don't know about but if we found them then other dimensions can be visible to us.

"In string theory, the universe may have more than the four familiar dimensions—up to ten or eleven dimensions of space and time, the extra dimensions could be compactified and not perceptible to our senses." 

– Brian Greene, [The Elegant Universe.]

Multiverse Theory (The Multi-Verse):

"The multiverse is the idea that our universe is just one of countless others, each with its own laws of physics, constants, and realities. In the 'many-worlds' interpretation, every time a quantum event occurs, the universe splits into parallel branches, creating alternate versions of reality where every possible outcome happens or the way its shown in the movies like in dragon ball the time travel od tunks to warn others about the androids and goku not dying because he got the medicine of heart disease, so, this reality changed by him staying alive.

"In the many-worlds interpretation, all possible outcomes of quantum measurements are physically realized in some 'world' or universe, leading to an ever-expanding multiverse." 

– Hugh Everett III (1957), this person is actually the guy who is called the originator of the Many-Worlds Interpretation (The Multi-Verse).

Observable Universe:

"The observable universe is but a small fraction of the entire cosmos. Theoretical models suggest that there may be regions of space-time beyond our observable reach, possibly containing different physical constants or even different types of universes."

 – Max Tegmark.

So, this also means that there might be something like the aliens who are out there or there is some other realm or maybe the black hole leads to another dimension, but the cameras stop working near the hole so we gotta throw someone in with some way to get him back to confirm this. And if there are aliens then we should find them and make them our slaves before they ever try to invade the earth.

This all might sound a bit crazy or you might think is this guy using a chair which is not balanced so maybe that's why he is saying such stuff but it's that when you are deep in science you do start to talk this way at times.

And it is possible that the like of them means that they might be similar planets to the Earth and different creatures might be living upon them.

And to end this i wanna share this aswell:

Dr. Maurice Bucaile said in his book the Science, Bible and The Quran:

"There are contradictions in the gospels about the ascension of Jesus and only two of them mention his ascension and the death of Jesus in these books are mentioned with a different way in each with too many contradictions as one passage said 40 women went to the tomb of Jesus but, in the other book only a single woman visited the tomb And The Gospels are like the Ahadith of the Muslims as they are narrated by people and are not written by eyewitnesses."

"When i started to study the Quran with an open mind i was shocked to see how anyone can say that a man who was illiterate has written this book ? and when i came across that it mentions what Modern Science is confirming today made me realize and had my belief on this book that it is not written by any man its completely divine as it described things which no human from the 6th century could and even the scientists here in France nor the romans or the Persians ever had any of the discoveries which are already mentioned 1300 years ago in the Quran."

link.title: The Miraculous Verses of the Holy Quran, for which even contemporary (Modern) science cannot offer an explanation for.

entry.title: Saying of Imam Shafi (rh)
entry.content:
"Every good thing for the Muslim is through the sake of Rasool Allah (SAW) and whatever bad does not befall us is also by his (SAW) grace."

(Al Risala pg 17)

قال امام الشافعي:

"كل خير للمسلم هو بفضل رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، وكل شر لا يصيبنا فهو أيضًا ببركته عليه الصلاة والسلام."

entry.title: Surah Al-Imran: 59, the verse
entry.content:
The Prophet - peace be upon him - was commanded to challenge them through a miraculous way, which is: the mutual invocation of curses. And the meaning of "mubahala": invoking a curse upon the wrongdoer from both parties. When this verse was revealed, the Messenger - peace be upon him - invited the delegation of Najran to mubahala. The Messenger of God - peace be upon him - came out carrying Al-Hussein, holding the hand of Al-Hasan, with Fatimah walking behind him, and Ali behind her, and he said to them: When I pray, say "Amen." The bishop of Najran said: O Christians: I see so birght and lighted faces that, if they asked God to move a mountain from its place, He would do so. So do not invoke curses and be destroyed, leaving no Christian on the face of the earth until the Day of Judgment. Then they accepted the tribute and left. The Messenger of God - peace be upon him - said: "By the One in whose hand is my soul, the punishment had descended upon the people of Najran, and if they had invoked curses, they would have been transformed into apes and pigs, and the valley would have been set ablaze against them, and God would have eradicated Najran and its people, even the birds on the trees, and the year would not have passed over the Christians until they perished". (Tafsir Tabari)

In Sahih al-Bukhari, Hudhayfah said: The Aqib and Sayyid, the leaders of Najran, came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, wanting to invoke a curse upon each other. One of them said to his companion: "Do not do it, for by Allah, if he is a prophet and we invoke a curse, we will not succeed, neither us nor our descendants after us." The Prophet, peace be upon him, went out with Hasan, Husayn, and Fatimah as Allah commanded: "Then say, 'Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves.'" [Al Imran: 61] But they were unable to challenge him.

The Christians were actually afraid to do that and by just seeing their faces they decided to run away.

entry.title: The Holy Quran and Modern Science:
entry.content:
Cosmology and the Origin of the Universe:
Allah Almighty says in the Holy Quran:

"Do not those who disbelieve see that the heavens and the earth were a closed-up mass, then We opened them out?"

This verse literally proved the big-bang theory and proved that what was written 1400 years ago to be correct and modern science confirms it, Aswell.

The Origin of Life and Water:

Science says that everything was created from water and cannot live without water, so this is what Allah (SWT) says in the Holy Quran:

"And We made from water every living thing. Then will they not believe?" (Quran 21:30)

The Protective Role of the Earth's Atmosphere:

"And We made the sky a protected canopy, but they turn away from its signs." (Quran 21:32)

"The Earth's atmosphere is a protective shield, absorbing and deflecting harmful solar radiation."
– NASA

Proved by the Holy Quran again.

Development of the Human Embryo:

"Then We made the sperm into a clot of congealed blood, then We made that clot a lump (a piece of flesh), then We made out of that lump bones and clothed the bones with flesh. Then We caused him to grow into another creation. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators." (23:13-14)

"The embryo undergoes several stages, including the 'somite' stage which resembles a blood clot."

– Keith L. Moore, Embryology Expert

The Water Cycle:

"It is Allah who sends the winds, so that they raise the clouds, and He spreads them across the sky as He wills, and He makes them fragments, and then you see the rain that He sends down from the sky, and He gives life to the Earth after its death. Such is the resurrection." (Quran 30:48)

"The water cycle is Earth's natural mechanism for recycling water, with the constant movement of water through evaporation, condensation, and precipitation."

– James E. Peebles (Physicist and Astronomer)

The Expanding of the Earth:

Quran (Surah An-Nazi'at 79:30): "And after that He spread the earth."

Science: "The Earth's lithosphere is made of tectonic plates that move and shift over time, contributing to the expansion of the Earth."
– Marie Tharp

The Shape of the Earth:

"And He it is who spread out the Earth (Meaning like a round ball)." (Quran 13:3)

Science:

"The Earth's roundness was confirmed by the observation of ships disappearing over the horizon and the curvature of the shadow during lunar eclipses."

– Eratosthenes (Greek Mathematician and Astronomer).

"The evidence from satellite images and global navigation confirms that the Earth is a round, spherical shape."

– Carl Sagan (Astronomer)

The Role of Mountains Holding the Earth:

"And He has set firm mountains in the Earth so that it would not shake with you." (Quran 16:15)

Surah An-Naba 78:6-7): "Have We not made the earth as a bed, and the mountains as pegs?"

Science:

"Mountains stabilize the Earth's crust, helping to prevent excessive shaking or movement."
– Geological Survey (by American professors)

The Expanding Universe:

Surah Adh-Dhariyat (51:47) "And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander."

Science:
"The universe is expanding, and this expansion is accelerating over time."

– Edwin Hubble (Astronomer)
This one is just an insane one how crazy for anyone to think that even this invention which they credit the modern science for was already in the Holy Quran and makes one believe that its surely divine because there is no way a human can ever think of something like that 1400 years ago.
Iron being sent from the Heavens:

Holy Quran 57:25)

"And We sent down Iron, in which strong material is very useful."

Science:
"Iron in Earth's crust was largely delivered by meteorites from space, especially during the early stages of Earth's formation."

– Carl Sagan

"The iron on Earth came from supernova explosions, where stars exploded and released heavy elements into space, which later coalesced into the Earth."

– Neil deGrasse Tyson (Astrophysicist)

They say it was from space and from the explosion of the Stars and thus science is again proving the Holy Quran' verses,
The Connection of the Brain and the Soul:

entry.title: The virtues of winter
entry.content:
:

Rasul Allah (S) said: "Fasting in winter is the cool gain (means an easy reward)".
(Tirmidhi 787 and in Musnad Ahmad)

Qatadah narrated to us, Anas narrated to us, he said: Abu Huraira (RA) said: Shall I not guide you to the cool gain? We said: And what is that, O Abu Huraira? He said: Fasting in winter.
(Sunan Al Kubara by Imam Bayhaqi Hadith no 8531)

from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri who said: The Messenger of Allah - peace be upon him - said: "Winter is the spring of the believer; its day is short, so he fasts, and its night is long, so he stands [in prayer]."
(Sunan Al Kubara by Imam Bayhaqi Hadith no 8532)

Al-Hasan Al Basri (rh) said: The believer's best season is winter: its night is long for standing in prayer, and its day is short for fasting.

Qatada (rh) said: The angels rejoice in winter for the believer, as the day is short, so he fasts, and the night is long, so he stands in prayer.

And when Ubayd ibn Umair al-Laythi (ra) came in winter, he would say:"O people of the Quran, the night has become long for your prayers, and the day has become short for your fasting.".

O my brother: Winter is the believer's spring.

Ibn Rajab Al Hanbali (rh) said: "Because he grazes in the gardens of obedience, roams in the fields of worship, and lets his heart wander in the meadows of facilitated deeds, just as animals graze in the spring pasture, fattening and strengthening their bodies. Similarly, the religion of a believer is strengthened in winter by the ease of performing acts of obedience that God has facilitated. A believer can fast during the winter days without hardship or difficulty from hunger or thirst, as the days are short and cold, so he does not feel the hardship of fasting.".

Al-Manawi (rh) said: "Fasting in winter is the cold bounty," meaning the bounty obtained without hardship.

Completing ablution thoroughly in severe cold is among the highest qualities of faith.

Ibn Sa'd narrated with his chain of transmission that Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, advised his son Abdullah at the time of his death, saying to him: "O my son! Adhere to the qualities of faith." He said: "And what are they?" He said: "Fasting in the intense heat of summer days, killing the enemies with the sword, patience in the face of calamity, perfecting ablution on a cold day, hastening to prayer on a cloudy day, and avoiding the dregs of madness." He said: "And what are the dregs of madness?" He said: "Drinking wine." (2)

Al-Awza'i narrated from Yahya bin Abi Kathir; he said: Six qualities, whoever possesses them has perfected faith: fighting the enemies of Allah with the sword, fasting in the summer, performing ablution thoroughly on a cold day, hastening to prayer on a cloudy day, avoiding argument and dispute while knowing you are truthful, and patience in the face of calamity.

entry.title: Ahadith on the Virtues of Sending Salawat upon the Prophet (S) on Friday.
entry.content:
Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah narrated to us, Al-Husayn ibn Ali narrated to us, from Abd al-Rahman ibn Yazid ibn Jabir, from Abu al-Ash'ath al-San'ani, from Shaddad ibn Aws, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, "Indeed, among the best of your days is Friday; on it, Adam was created, on it is the blowing of the trumpet, and on it is the swoon. So increase your prayers upon me on it, for your prayers are presented to me." A man said, "O Messenger of Allah, how are our prayers presented to you when you have decayed?" He said, "Indeed, Allah has forbidden the earth to consume the bodies of the prophets."

(Ibn Majah 1085)

On the authority of Aws ibn Aws (may Allah be pleased with him), he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Among the best of your days is Friday, so increase your prayers upon me on that day; for your prayers are presented to me."

(Sunan Abi Dawud 1531, Ibn Majah 1636, Sunan Al Kubara of An Nasa'i 1666)

The Prophet ﷺ: "Whoever sends blessings upon me in a book, the angels will continue to seek forgiveness as long as my name remains in that book."

Narrated by Abu Huraira (1).

The Prophet ﷺ: "Whoever sends blessings upon me at my grave, I hear him, and whoever sends blessings upon me from afar, it is conveyed to me."

Narrated by Abu Huraira (2).

The Prophet ﷺ said: "Whoever sends blessings upon me at my grave, I hear him, and whoever sends blessings upon me from afar, an angel is appointed to convey it to me, and it suffices for his worldly and hereafter affairs, and I will be a witness or an intercessor for him."

Hib, and Al-Khatib from Abu Huraira (3).

The Prophet (S) said: "Whoever sends blessings upon me on Friday, it will be an intercession for him with me on the Day of Resurrection."

Al-Daylami from Aisha (SA).

Narrated by Abu Abdullah Muhammad bin Abdullah Al-Hafiz, in Nishapur, from Muhammad bin Abi Mu'adh from his father, from Ibrahim bin Adham, from Muhammad bin Ajlan, from Ali bin Al-Husayn, from his father, from Ali bin Abi Talib, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever sends blessings upon me one hundred times on Friday will come on the Day of Resurrection with a light that, if distributed among all creation, would suffice them."
(Hilayat Awliya)

The Prophet ﷺ said:
"Whoever sends blessings upon me one hundred times on Friday and the night of Friday, Allah will fulfill one hundred needs for him: seventy of the needs of the Hereafter and thirty of the needs of this world. Allah appoints an angel to deliver it to my grave just as gifts are delivered to one of you. My knowledge after my death is like my knowledge during my life." 
(Al-Daylami from Hakama from her father Uthman bin Dinar from his brother Malik bin Dinar from Anas)."

Also narrated by: Al-Bayhaqi in Shu'ab al-Iman (3/111, No. 3035).
This is a Sahih Hadith and the best one about the Prophet (S) still having the same knowledge which Allah (SWT) granted him during his blessed life.

Imam Ibn Al Qayyim (rh) said:

"The second characteristic: It is recommended to frequently send blessings upon the Prophet - peace be upon him - on this day and its night, for he said: "Increase your prayers upon me on Friday and the night of Friday".

The Messenger of Allah - peace be upon him - is the master of mankind, and Friday is the master of days. Therefore, sending prayers upon him on this day has a special merit not found on other days. Another wisdom is that every good his nation received in this world and the hereafter was through him, as Allah combined for his nation the good of this world and the hereafter through him. The greatest honor they receive will occur on Friday, as it is the day they are sent to their homes and palaces in paradise, and it is the day of increase for them when they enter paradise. It is a holiday for them in this world, and a day when Allah Almighty fulfills their requests and needs, and does not turn away their supplications. All of this was known and achieved because of him and through him. Therefore, out of gratitude, praise, and fulfilling a small part of his due right of him- ﷺ - it is encouraged to frequently send prayers upon him on this day and its night."

(Zaad Al Maa'd 1/461)

link.title: Ahadith on the Virtues of Sending Salawat upon the Prophet (S) on Friday.

entry.title: Virtues of Sayyiduna Umar Bin Khattab (RA)
entry.content:
In the virtues of Sayyiduna Umar Bin Khattab (RA) by Ibn Abi al-Dunya and the one by Al Suyuti, it is mentioned that the earth quaked during the time of Umar. He struck it with his hand and said: "What is wrong with you? What is wrong with you? If it were the Day of Judgment, it would have revealed its news." I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: "On the Day of Judgment, there will not be a span or a cubit that does not speak."

Imam Ahmad mentioned from Safiyyah the same narration and with a very strong chain of transmission.

And since he struck the ground with his hand and commanded the earthquake to cease, not a single earthquake has occurred in the blessed city of Medina or in Mecca. And not a single scientific report ever recorded an earthquake there after that, and not even a narration is recorded of a single earthquake that came after that event and they stopped after that.

entry.title: The legend of Mount Qaf (قاف) From the sources:
entry.content:
Abu Salih narrated from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them. And Ikrimah also narrated from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, saying God created a mountain called Qaf that surrounds the lower world, and its roots are connected to the rock on which the earth stands, and it is the rock mentioned by Luqman, peace be upon him, when he said: "O my son, if it is the weight of a mustard seed and it is in a rock or in the heavens or in the earth" [the verse]. So when God Almighty wants to shake a village on earth, He orders that mountain to move the root that is next to that village, and it shakes at that moment. Mujahid said: It is a mountain that surrounds the earth and the seas. It is narrated from Al-Dahhak that it is an emerald that is green.

(From the works of Ibn Abi Hatim, Imam Ismael, Ibn Kathir tafsir, Ibn Hajar Al Haythami' fatwas 248 and the famous Ibn Abi Ad Dunya narrated it aswell in kitab Al qubat pg, 32).

And a group of scholars believe that the word Qaf in Surah Qaf means this mountain 
And Ibn Kathir said:
"A group of the Salaf used to say that it is about a mountain called Qaf that surrounds the seven earths. (And Ibn Abbas (RA) belongs to this group)".
He added further:
"It is narrated by many, but this is a story about which God knows best, because we cannot reject it either".

And the famous story of Dhul Qurnain visiting this mountain (Jabl Qaf) is authentic and it has been narrated with many isnads and there is reality in this story as there is also a saying of Ibn Abbas (RA) where he said that Dhul Qurnain made Alexandria out of white marble that is why they used to wear black there and later the monks there also wore black as it was started by Dhul Qurnain.

And one thing that they say is that Dhul Qurnain came to this mountain to find the water of everlasting life, but this is not true because this is not proved, we are allowed to narrate from the People of the Book as God has allowed us in the Glorious Quran so that we can narrate from them, but one thing is that there are things in them that sound different or strange to our stories, then we reject them and otherwise we accept them blindly, and the story of St George (Jerjis) is also accepted by Muslims as Muslims. Otherwise we don't reject them or accept them blindly, we remain neutral towards them and the story of St. George (Jerjis) is also accepted by the Muslims because the Muslims narrated it more than the Christians and gave more details about this story which even the Christians did not have.

And there is another story it is very long also used by Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Abi Al Dunya let me tell you guys that one in short:

"Jibrael landed on Mount Qaf, and he saw rivers of different colours, blue, green, etc., and he saw creatures that were different, and he had never seen anything like this before, and he said: O my Lord, what is all this? I thought that I was the most special creature that You had created.
And Allah (SWT) said to him, "O Jibreel! you thought that you were the only good creation of your Lord, and this is nothing, and you have not yet seen the true power of your Lord, for this is only a small glimpse of His power and His glory.
And the Jibreel prostrated himself and said, "O my Lord, glory be to thee, there is none like thee, and thy power is above all."

And in another narration it is mentioned that the creatures who are in Mount Qaf do not know who is Adam and who is Shaitan and what is evil, and they are away from these things without any knowledge.
And even some scholars say that when the Day of Judgment comes, this earth will be finished, and some believe that the creatures that are on that mountain, the scholars say that it may be replaced with it after the Day of Judgment, And only Allah knows better.

Ibn Hajar al Haythami (rh) said:

"The philosophers have made the belief and rejected the text in which its clearly mentioned that how earth quakes are caused by the angel who moves the vein of Mount Qaf and it causes an earthquake and the philosophers say that it is only because the inside of the ground gets hot so its caused but its against the text".
(Fatwas of Ibn Hajar pg, 248)

And the traditional scholars were of the opinion that the existence of Mount Qaf cannot be denied and the narration of Ibn Abbas is not only from one book it has been narrated with different chains and even Ikrimah (RA) narrated what Ibn Abbas (RA) said in one narration and the great Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Al Dunya and many other scholars also narrated this narration. And in the journal of the University of Medina they also wrote that they accept the narration of Ibn Abbas (RA) as authentic because a chain is very good. 

And they said that the earthquake is only caused by the heating of the inside of the earth and this is the only reason and all the scholars of the university agree on this but this is what the philosophers said as Ibn Hajar wrote in his fatwa and they reject the text even when it is not contradicted by the strong text so we have to accept it instead of rejecting it.

And One thing which was also in the journal of the Uni of Medina the writer of the Journal wrote:

"That the narration of Ibn Abbas with the Isnad of Ibn Abi Hatim is good but Ibn Abbas (RA) must have taken it from the Israelies and from the jews as this is not Islamic and he took it from them for sure."

I think it's fair to say that's a pretty far-fetched claim. It's also quite vague. This accusation that the Companion of the Prophet (S) is accused of taking stories from the Jews is quite far-fetched. And the scholar who wrote this about him should fear Allah (SWT).

And there is a narration which is often mentioned in many tafsirs that a Companion asked the Prophet (S) about this mount so he replied:
"He informed him that it is Mount "Qaf," and that its height is a journey of five hundred years, and its length is a journey of two thousand years, and that it is made of green emerald."

And the word "tohu" which is in the herbew if we arabize that word then it turns into "Qaf" so this word after getting arabized becomes Qaf.
And even in the Jewish Scripture this is mentioned with the word Tohu in the herbew language.
(i took the herbew words from this book on judaism called 'Hachikah')

And this mountain is also quite famous in arab culture as you can read so many story books and they have made stories about this mountain and in the one thousand one nights or the arabian nights in that you can find stories about these mountains which are that some jinn kidnap some princess (ngl those stories made us imagine the jinn like some desperate creatures and horny but its not like that and those stories are fake aswell)

And What i have mentioned in this essay is from what the Scholars have said regarding this and what has been the belief of the Scholars of the Ahlus Sunnah regarding this Mountain (قاف).

And now to prove the earthquake narration being real is also proved from science:

Dr. David Rothery, a volcanologist at The Open University, "The movement of tectonic plates is the fundamental driver of both earthquakes and volcanic activity. Where tectonic plates meet, stress builds up and is released through earthquakes, while the same processes can lead to the formation and eruption of volcanoes. And the Movement inside the Ground causes earth to shake resulting in what you call an Earth-Quake".

So it is also proved from the Quote of this Professor that something shakes inside the Ground and because of that other plates also shake and the Eath moves.

But the question now is, who makes the earth move?
As it was mentioned in the narrations above that Allah (SWT) orders His angel to shake the vein from Mount Qaf, and we can believe this because science also confirms that something moves it, and we all know that there is something that does everything, the One who made the Big Bang possible, the One who keeps the sky from falling.
And we know that it is Allah (SWT), so from the above narrations it is proven that Allah orders His angel to shake the vein that comes from Mount Qaf, and then the shaking that occurs makes a certain place shake because it results in an earthquake.

Thus Those narrations are proved from Science aswell.

entry.title: How to pray Salah?
entry.content:
There are 5 Fard(required)prayers sinful to miss. 

Fajr - 2 rakats(units)
Dhuhr - 4 rakats 
Asr - 4 rakats
Maghrib- 3 rakats 
Isha- 4 rakats 

1.Starting Salah (Intention and Takbir)
Begin by forming an intention in your heart to pray a specific prayer (e.g., Dhuhr, Asr). While the intention is usually kept in the heart, some may choose to say it verbally. Start with Takbir ("Allahu Akbar"), raising hands to either the shoulders or the ears.

2. Placing the Hands
After Takbir, you can place your hands either:

Below the navel , above the navel but below the chest.Or, leave them at your sides.

3. Reciting Surah Al-Fatihah
Recite Surah Al-Fatihah yourself for silent prayers and audibly for prayers like Fajr, Maghrib, and Isha. This is Sunnah but not required but highly recommended.  Reciting Surah Al-Fatihah, you may either:

Recite "Bismillah ir-Rahman ir-Rahim" quietly or aloud or skip the Basmala altogether in silent prayers.

After finishing Al-Fatihah, recite another surah or verses from the Quran if you wish.

4. Going into Ruku’ (Bowing)
Say "Allahu Akbar" and bow, placing your hands on your knees. For Ruku’, you may:

Raise your hands to the shoulders or ears before bowing.Or, keep hands down without raising them again.

5. Standing Back Up (I’tidal)
When rising from Ruku', you may:

Raise hands to the shoulders or ears and say "Sami’ Allahu liman hamidah" ("Allah hears those who praise Him").Or, do not raise the hands again and simply say the phrase. 

Once fully standing, you can say "Rabbana wa lakal-hamd" ("Our Lord and to You is all praise").

6. Sujood (Prostration)
Say "Allahu Akbar" and go into sujood - 2 per rakat , placing your hands and knees on the ground. When moving into sujood:

Some prefer to go down on hands first, then knees.Others place knees first, then hands.

In sujood, make sure that the forehead, nose, palms, knees, and toes touch the ground.

7. Tashahhud (Sitting Position and Finger Position)
During Tashahhud - second rakat and fourth rakat , third rakat in Maghrib, keep your right index finger pointed in different ways:

Raise it briefly when saying "Ashhadu alla ilaha illa Allah" and then put it down.Or keep it pointed and moving slightly throughout the Tashahhud. Or raise it and keep it steady without movement.

Complete the Tashahhud, and add the final supplications (Durood and Dua).

8. Ending Salah (Tasleem)
To conclude Salah, turn your head to the right and say "Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullah," then to the left saying the same.

entry.title: Abu Jahl the loser
entry.content:
Once the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) prostrated, Abu Jahl (LA) picked up a stone and approached him. But when he got close, he turned back, terrified and pale, his hands dried on the stone until he dropped it. The men of Quraysh came to him and said: "What's wrong with you, O Abu al-Hakam?"
He said: I went up to him to do what I told you yesterday, but as I approached him, a male camel appeared in front of me. By God, I have never seen a head like his, nor a neck or tusks like his for any male camel. He was about to devour me.
Abu Jahl's heroism was imaginary, and his boasting of threats was sophistical. It wasn't just once that he retreated, but many times, as narrated by the author of "Al-Halabiya" and Ibn Kathir in the biography, including:
Al-Araashi, a man from the tribe of Khath'am, sold camels to Abu Jahl, who then delayed payment. The Quraysh directed him to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, knowing Abu Jahl's intense enmity towards the message and its bearer, peace and blessings be upon him. When Al-Araashi explained his situation to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he went with him to ensure he received his due from Abu Jahl. When he knocked on Abu Jahl's door, Abu Jahl came out with a pale face, as if he were dust-colored, which is a yellowish hue with dullness. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to him, "Give this man his right." Abu Jahl replied, "Yes, do not leave until I give him what is his." And he handed it over to him.
Abu Jahl (LA) whenever he intended to hurt or insult Rasul Allah ﷺ Allah (SWT) always helped his Prophet ﷺ and made Abu Jahl afraid so much that he would start trembling. The one who used to make bold claims infront of the kuffar and the muhsriks would start sweating after seeing Rasul Allah ﷺ.

God has made the beginning and the end of this work the best, by the grace of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and his family and companions."

"To the esteemed gentlemen, may God unite us and them in the abode of peace, with peace.

All praise is due to God, the Lord of the Worlds, and He is my sufficiency and the best guardian. There is no power and no strength except through God, the Most High, the Magnificent.

It was a privilege for whoever compiled this book ..."

entry.title: The Prophecy of Prophet Daniel (AS) explanation from the Bible of the ending of the 4 kingdoms and a Solid state replacing them
entry.content:
”goat of the wild beast ” that defeated the ram that symbolizes the Medes and Persians.” (Daniel (8:21) ”And the fourth kingdom will be solid as iron, for iron crushes and crushes all things.” ”And as iron breaks, it shatters and breaks in pieces all these” (this is about the Roman Empire) (Daniel (2:40) Nebuchadnezzar saw a stone cut out of a great mountain without a cutter, and it struck that statue on its feet, which were of iron and clay. And the blow was so strong that the whole statue was shattered, with its gold, silver, bronze, iron, and clay, and became fragments and rubble, blown away by the wind, so that no trace of it was seen. But the stone that broke the statue became a great, high mountain, and the whole earth was filled with it. This is a prophecy of the emergence of Islam. Islam clashed at the beginning of the call with the Roman Empire and then with the Persian Empire. At that time, the Roman Empire had extended its authority over the Greek king of Alexandria and reached the peak of strength. The Persian Empire had extended its authority over Babylon, then the power of Islam struck them, and at that time iron, pottery, copper and silver were crushed together and became like chaff from the threshing floor in the summer.

 Thus, the arrangement of events and their interpretation in Daniel’s vision foretells news whose meaning is beyond doubt... since we know that Babylon was succeeded by Persia and Media and that the power of Persia and Media was broken by the power of Alexander, and that the kingdom of Alexander was succeeded by the Roman Empire, which established from its capital Constantinople the pillars of a European-Asian kingdom. Then this kingdom was defeated and the Islamic conquest and the raids of the Prophet ﷺ and the Companions brought it down .” And then we had the Ottoman Empire, which completely wiped out the Roman Empire and brought Islam to all possible places and became a great cause in spreading Islam in the Balkans. And as for the Christians claiming that they still rule those places now, that does not mean that they are correct, because there is no Christian rule there, but completely secular, and this prophecy was about a force that would cover all the lands, and it was fulfilled as the Muslims literally conquered all the places they had and ruled them and crushed them, just as it was written in the prophecy of Daniel AS. And when Imam Mahdi will come, no land will remain in the rule of Christians or anyone else, he will end all the enemies of Islam and he will have his army which is famously known as the Black Flag Army and his army with him will conquer all the places and this time they will not allow anyone to remain as a polytheist, they will have no choice but to convert to Islam or fight and when they will fight, all of them will be ended and in some time Jesus AS will come back and This time they will not allow anyone to remain a polytheist and they will have no choice but to convert to Islam or to fight and when they will fight all of them will be finished and in some time Jesus AS will come back again and all the Christians will convert to Islam and thus once again the Muslims will get back their great army and will rule over the whole world.
