entry.title: Imam An Nawawi (rh) on Muslim 2674 Hadith in the Sharh Sahih Muslim (vol:16/228)
entry.content:
"This Hadith [2674] Whoever calls to guidance and whoever calls to misguidance, these two hadiths are clear in urging the desirability of establishing good things and the prohibition of establishing bad things, and that whoever establishes a good Sunnah will have a reward like that of everyone who acts upon it, until On the Day of Resurrection, whoever establishes a bad practice will bear the burden of everyone who acts upon it until the Day of Resurrection. And whoever calls to guidance will have the rewards of those who follow him, or to misguidance will bear the sins of those who follow him, whether that guidance or misguidance was initiated by him or he was preceded to it, and whether that was teaching. Knowledge, worship, etiquette, or other than that. His statement, may God bless him and grant him peace, “and he acted upon it after him” means that if he established it, whether the action was during his life or after his death, and God knows best."

And What is mentioned as Good here is what is Good in Islam and a good deed if anyone introduces a way for good then it is not considered bad if its good for anyone and is benefical for the People.

And we can also use the Hadith without going into its explanation and can use it to prove that establishing good means that whoever establishes a good act will have reward for introducing it and regarding Mawlid its a very good practise which is proved from the text is a very benefical one for the believer so those who introduced it and celebrated it in the proper way will have its reward if others follow them correctly.

link.title: Imam An Nawawi (rh) on Muslim 2674 Hadith in the Sharh Sahih Muslim (vol:16/228)

entry.title: Mulla Ali Qari’a commentary of the Shifa
entry.content:
The text in English is translated as followed:

"... and it is not the place to mention all of them ('and in the narration is a long story'), meaning in the actions of the day and night for Ibn Al-Sunni, may Allah be pleased with him. Abdullah Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, lost movement and weakness overcame his limbs, as though they were the limbs of a man overcome by laziness and incapacity, deprived of movement. It was said to him, 'Shall I remind you of the name of the most beloved to you, and will this affliction be removed from you?' He (Ibn Umar) responded with 'Yes.' So he called with the loudest of his voice, 'Ya Muhammadah!' (O Muhammad!). Immediately, his limbs were restored, and it was as though nothing had afflicted him."

This is in volume 2, page 43 in the Sharh of Al Shifa.

The Story being mentioned here is :

He said, ‘If the person who said this had realised Islam, he would have become a Muslim.’ The meaning is that you will meet what is destined for you, which is Allah, the Almighty, and she wants to know, because death sometimes takes the honourable and sometimes annihilates the unkind, and the meaning is that I wish I knew about it. (and my beloved) with the opening of the Ya, not as Al-Antaqi said necessary (al-Dar), meaning whether they will prevent me from visiting him (meaning) the woman by saying my beloved (the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace) and by saying al-Dar (Paradise, the place of decision) (so ‘Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) sat crying) i.e. for longing or for separation or parting. 

It is narrated (in the Day and Night Work of Ibn al-Sunni) that ‘Abdullah ibn ’Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) had a numbness in his leg, meaning that it was unable to move and was weakened by the gathering of its nerves due to laziness and lethargy, like a sleepy man, and it did not go away (it was said to him He cried out at the top of his voice, ‘O Muhammadah!’ with a silent eh, as if he wanted to show his love as part of an appeal for help (and his leg immediately spread out), as if he wanted to show his love as well within the context of seeking help (Istighatha).

And Imam Mulla Ali Qari (rh) used the word Istighatha in his work as what Ibn Umar (RA) said was clearly Ya Muhammadah which is understood in Arabic language in the sense of asking someone for help and the Companions said this during the battle of Yamamah against Musalma the liar.

Ibn Al Sunni (rh) , from Mujahid who said A man's leg became numb in the presence of Ibn 'Abbas, and Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) said: "Name the person you love the most: Muhammad, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.

link.title: Mulla Ali Qari’a commentary of the Shifa

entry.title: Prophet ﷺ will be a witness for the Ummah
entry.content:
There are 5 ayats in the Qur’an that say that the Prophet ﷺ will be an witness for the Ummah on the Day of Judgement. Those 4 ayats are : Surah Baqarah 2:143 , Surah An Nisa 4:41 , Surah Ahzab 33:45-46 , Surah Al Fath 48:8 , Surah Nahl 16:84/16:89. The other ayat about being a witness (Surah Al Maida 5:117) is about the Prophet Isa(Jesus) AS implying that other Prophets and Messengers will be witness for their people.

Also, Surah Al Isra 17:71 states that people will be summoned with "their leader". This could be mean deeds , Prophet or scripture. As per footnote in the ayat. The tafsir of Ibn Kathir says that the meaning could also mean "Imam , Mujahid". "Qatadah said that it meant each nation would be called to account by its Prophet." "Ibn Zayd said it means they would be called to account by their Book which was revealed to their Prophet with its laws. " 

This links with this hadith:
“My life is good for you, and my death is good for you, your deeds are shown to me, whatever is good I thank Allah for it, and whatever is evil I seek forgiveness from Allah.”[Imam Bazzar, Musnad Bazzar] 

This shows that the Prophet ﷺ sees our deeds. When ever we do a good deed he thanks Allah and when we sin he seeks forgiveness for us from Allah. 

Similarly,  we have an angel who writes our good deeds and one who writes our bad deeds. They will be our witness as well. As well as this, if someone was to reject his sins on the day of judgement then those body parts whom we did the sin will be a witness against him.

In a book written by Imam Suyuti called Sharh as-Sudur. In a chapter, a hadith is found where the Prophet ﷺ says people who have died were are related to you if they find out you've done good they'll do dua for you asking for your guidance like they have been guidance. This shows that this is regarding people who are in a good state. [Imam Ahmad: Musnad from Anas with some weakness in the chain or narration]. 

Abu Ayyub is reported to have said that the "actions are presented to the deceased " , if it's good they'll be happy and do dua for it to be accepted and it's bad they'll do dua for the bad action to be rejected.[Ibn Mubarak: az-Zuhd with a sound chain, Ibn Ibi Dunya: al-Munamat]

Sources

Quran.com Mustafa Khattib Translation 
Quran.com Ibn Kathir tafsir
https://seekersguidance.org/answers/islamic-belief/presentation-of-the-deeds-of-the-living-to-the-deceased-and-martyrs-and-their-ranks/

link.title: Prophet ﷺ will be a witness for the Ummah

entry.title: Good Innovation and Bad Innovation from the views of Traditional and the Greatest Scholars of Islam and Evidence from the Text:
entry.content:
As the scholars Ibn Hajar and An Nawawi (may Allah have mercy on them) explained in their works (Fath Al Bari and Sharh Sahih Muslim):
"That these two ahadith are about any act that is not in the Sunnah or from it."

And the hadith that every innovation is misguidance is also about the acts that are not from the Sunnah, an act that is not proven by the acts of the Companions or anywhere else from the text.

And the Hadith about the Good Sunnah: 
"Whoever establishes a good practice in Islam will have its reward and the reward of whoever acts upon it until the Day of Resurrection."

And this means here the good deeds and we know that all the good deeds in Islam are from the Sunnah and if there is any other good deed then it is from the way of the Companions and the people of the Salaf.

And innovation is what is not in the Sunnah or any act that cannot be proved from the Sunnah or from the views of the Companions or the Salaf, then they declared it as an innovation, but even innovation (Bid'ah) is in 5 parts.

And the traditional view of Ahlus Sunnah was that innovation is of 5 types, we can take the book of any scholar as an example if we take the work of An Nawawi (rh) "Adab al Quran 189):
"Writing the Quran and noting it down is also an innovation, but it is beneficial, so it is a good innovation according to the consensus."

And when we become scholars, we also study Arabic grammar and many other rules as well, but the Companions didn't learn it all the way we do now, and learning about these things is also an innovation, but its good because its for a good purpose and beneficial.

And Imam Tahawi in Kashf Isthalat:

"Bid'ah is of 5 types Good, Bad (haram), Disliked (Makruh), Recommended (Mustahabb), Neutral (Mubāh)."

Every act proven from the text is a good innovation, as Imam Shafi (rh) said that Bidah is of two types: good, which comes from the Companions, and bad, which contradicts the text.

Sayyiduna Umar (RA) said on two different occasions that this innovation is good and in another narration "Blessing of Bidah".
(Both recorded in Sahih Al Bukhari)

And the scholars of the Sunnah agree on the types of innovation". (Tahawi's quote ends here, it is too long as he quotes too many scholars to prove this).

And Even Imam Ahmad Ibn Hanbal (rh) said:
"Innovation is of types."
So this is proof that the scholars of the Ahlus Sunna throughout history have said that there are types of innovation and there was no disagreement among them, but only a small group that became Ahlul Hadith and ignored the explanations of the Hadith went wrong on issues and committed errors without fixing them.

And if all the scholars of the past were wrong, as some say, then their books shouldn't be studied, but without them we cannot have any Islamic scholarship, and those great scholars are so important that without their works and opinions we cannot understand or go deep into Islam.

And They say that the Hadith regarding
"Every Innovation is Misguidance".
Scholars have explained it that innovation that is in religion and worship that cannot be proved from the text or from the Companions and acts that are added to religion and are not from the Sunnah of the Prophet ﷺ so this is the definition of this hadith that we must avoid this type of innovation and those who do this type of innovation are called innovators.

And the Saying of Muadh Ibn Jabal (RA) :
"Whatever the Muslims (majority of them) see as Good is Good."

This saying of the Companion is explained in Sharh Miskhat Al Masibh by Mulla Ali Qari (rh):
"The saying of seeing as good means what was the consensus of the Muslims on a subject, as the majority that had a consensus on something from the early times will be right."
(Sharh of Hadith number 1345 in the edition which I use)

Shaykh Ibn Tayimiyyah (rh) in Majmu fatawi (20/163):

"The misguidance of those who innovate a path or a belief, claiming that the faith is not complete without it, while knowing that the Messenger did not mention it, is known. Whatever contradicts the texts is an innovation according to the consensus of Muslims. Whatever is not known to contradict them cannot be called an innovation. Al-Shafi'i - may Allah have mercy on him - said: There are two types of innovation: an innovation that contradicts the Book, the Sunnah, and the consensus. And according to some of the companions of the Messenger of God, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, this is an innovation of misguidance. And an innovation that does not contradict any of this, then it is good, because of the saying of Umar: What a good innovation this is, these words or something like them. Al-Bayhaqi narrated it with his authentic chain of transmission in Al-Madkhal."

This information should be more than enough to explain the concept of what innovation (Bid'ah) is in Islam and the view of traditional scholars is always correct as the majority agree and there is a consensus on this issue by the majority that its correct.

link.title: Good Innovation and Bad Innovation from the views of Traditional and the Greatest Scholars of Islam and Evidence from the Text:

entry.title: Ayats that are about Polytheists but are used against the wrong people
entry.content:
There are ayats in the Qur’an that are aimed at Meccan polytheists and/or disbelievers but in this day and age, some ignorants use them against believers of the religion.

Surah Baqarah 2:170
When it is said to them, “Follow what Allah has revealed,” they reply, “No! We ˹only˺ follow what we found our forefathers practicing.” ˹Would they still do so,˺ even if their forefathers had ˹absolutely˺ no understanding or guidance?

This ayat is aimed at the polytheists and disbelievers. It criticises them for rejecting the truth because they want to follow their ancestors in disbelief and idol worship. This ayat was revealed after a group of Jews refused to follow the truth instead wanting to remain in disbelief.

Surah Al-An'am 6:116
"'O Prophet!˺ If you were to obey most of those on earth, they would lead you away from Allah’s Way. They follow nothing but assumptions and do nothing but lie.

This ayat is aimed the majority of the people on earth which happened to be disbelievers at the time. This is true in times of today. For example, the Muslim population is newly 2 billion and the world is population is 7-8 billion. Therefore, the majority are disbelievers. In those times, Islam was smaller in numbers and the majority of the were disbelievers. 

Surah Al Zumar 39:3
Indeed, sincere devotion is due ˹only˺ to Allah. As for those who take other lords besides Him, ˹saying,˺ “We worship them only so they may bring us closer to Allah,” surely Allah will judge between all regarding what they differed about. Allah certainly does not guide whoever persists in lying and disbelief.

This ayat is aimed at the Meccan polytheists,  who would worship idols claiming that they will bring them closer to Allah. The idols were in the face of angels. They thought that worshipping them would allow the angels to intercede with Allah to help them. This ayat is a condemnation for them and all polytheists who do the same. If someone was to go to the grave of the Prophet ﷺ and ask for intercession, then provided he knows that the Prophet ﷺ is the intermediary and only Allah can accept the intercession then it can't be considered as worship like the polytheists did. This is seen as a way to get closer to Allah like someone reading the Qur’an , giving charity , etc.

Surah Tawbah 9:31
They have taken their rabbis and monks as well as the Messiah, son of Mary, as lords besides Allah, even though they were commanded to worship none but One God. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. Glorified is He above what they associate ˹with Him˺!

This ayat is aimed at Christian and Jews. After this ayat was revealed, a companion of the Prophet ﷺ said "but Jews and Christians do not worship their rabbis and monks!" ,  ﷺ replied “Do the rabbis and monks not forbid the permissible and permit the forbidden, and they obey them?”. The companion said "yes they so". The Prophet then concluded that "this is how they worship them". Their rabbis and monks don't forbid them to avoid things that are forbidden and allow them to do bad things. They still obeyed them. As for Muslims who trust proper scholars the same cannot be said as those scholars told people to do good and avoid evil according to guidelines to the best of their ability and also, In the Qur’an it has many verses that says to obey Allah and His Messenger and proper scholars did this so trusting them is fine. 

Surah Kafirun 109:1-6
Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O you disbelievers!
I do not worship what you worship,
nor do you worship what I worship.
I will never worship what you worship,
nor will you ever worship what I worship.
You have your way, and I have my Way.”

This surah is about the Meccan polytheists in particular. The polytheists asked the Prophet ﷺ to worship their idols in return they claimed that they would be Muslim. Then then this surah was revealed.

link.title: Ayats that are about Polytheists but are used against the wrong people

entry.title: Salawat تنجينا:
entry.content:
"Imam Al Saffouri (rh) writes in his book "كتاب نزهة المجالس ومنتخب النفائس" (2/86)

"I saw the Prophet (SAW) in a dream one night and he told me to tell others to recite this : 

اللهم صل على محمد صلاة تنجينا بها من جميع الأهوال والآفات وتقضي لنا بها جميع الحاجات وتطهرنا بها من جميع السيئات وترفعنا بها عندك أعلى الدرجات وتبلغنا بها أقصى الغايات من جميع الخيرات في الحياة وبعد الممات عناق على كولي شاين قدير

Allahumma salli ‘ala Muhammad salatan tunajjina biha min jami’ al-ahwal wal-afat wa taqdi lana biha jami’ al-hajat wa tutahhiruna biha min jami’ as-sayyi’at wa tarfa’una biha ‘indaka a’la ad-darajat wa tuballighuna biha aqsa al-ghayat min jami’ al-khayrat fil-hayati wa ba’da al-mamat, innaka ‘ala kulli shay’in qadir.

O Allah, send blessings upon Muhammad, a prayer through which You save us from all terrors and calamities, fulfill for us all needs, purify us from all sins, raise us to the highest ranks in Your presence, and bring us to the utmost of all goodness in this life and after death. Indeed, You have power over all things.

entry.title: Imam Al Razi in his Tafsir Al Kabir about the Hand of Allah (SWT)
entry.content:
(He is rejecting those who called that the Hand of Allah is a physical organ like humans)
The evidence for this is that a body is inseparable from movement and stillness, which are new, and anything that is inseparable from the new is new, and because every body is infinite in size, and whatever is infinite in size is new, and whatever is infinite in size is new, and whatever is infinite in size is new And because every body is composed of parts, and everything that is so is susceptible to composition and dissolution, and everything that is so requires something to compose and synthesise it, and everything that is so is a novelty, thus proving in these ways that it is impossible for Him to be a body, so it is impossible for His hand to be a bodily member. As for the majority of monotheists, they have two opinions regarding the word hand: First: The statement of those who say: When the Qur'an proves that God's hand is a hand, we believe in it, and when reason proves that it is impossible for God's hand to be an expression of a specific body and a complex organ of parts and parts, we believe in it, but as for what the hand is and what its reality is, we have entrusted the knowledge of it to God the Exalted, and this is the way of the Salaf.

(12/395)

link.title: Imam Al Razi in his Tafsir Al Kabir about the Hand of Allah (SWT)

entry.title: The Reality of the Belief about the World being created for Rasool Allah (SAW) 💚
entry.content:
Muhammad Ibn Sinan said, "Hushaim said, "Sayyar - Abu al-Hakam - said, "Yazid al-Fakir said, "Jabir bin Abdullah said, "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, "I was given five things that were not given to any of the prophets before me. I was given victory by terror (terror in heart of his enemies) for a month's march, and "the earth was made for me" a mosque and a sanctuary, and any man of my nation who is caught in prayer should pray (he can perform tayyamum anywhere from the earth), and I was given the right to the spoils of war, and a prophet used to be sent to his own people in particular, but I was sent to all men in general, and I was given intercession."

[Sahih Al Bukhari 438]
Its also narrated by Muslim and in other big Hadith collections.

This hadith mentions the word that this world was created for me and as a mosque and other narrations such as the one in Musnad Ahmad which Ibn Kathir used in his tafsir only has the words that this world was created for me at the end of this hadith.

And in other narrations that Ibn Asakir (rh) recorded, it is about the world being created for him, and the thing is that not all of these narrations are fake, and there are narrations that are supported by similar narrations, like the one in Musnad Ahmad that I mentioned, which also supports those narrations that the world was created for him.

And Imam Ibn Rajab Al Hanbali (rh) in Latif Mar'if [74] said:
"These narrations have a reality, as they support one another and are proved by each other."

And Ibn Tayimiyyah (rh) said:

"When Adam was created, God wrote my prophethood and revealed it before the soul was breathed into him, just as God writes the slave's livelihood, his time, his work, and whether he will be happy or unhappy if he creates the fetus before the soul is breathed into it. If man is the seal of the creatures, the last of them, the sum total of all of them, and his virtue is the virtue of the creatures at all, and Muhammad is the man of this eye and the center of this millstone and the parts of this assembly were as if they were the ultimate ends of the creatures, it is not denied that for him it is said that all of them were shaved and if it was not for him, it would not have been created, so that if this speech and similar is explained by what is indicated in the Book and Sunnah, then this is acceptable to him. So this is unobjectionable (and cannot be refuted)."

(Majmu Rasil wal Masail vol,1 pg,157)

All of them were with the belief that the world was created for the Prophet (SAW). Even Ibn Kathir is one of those with this belief and also Imam Dahabi in his Siyar and Tarikh Al Islam has said things that put him in the list of great scholars who are with the belief that this world was created for Rasool Allah (SAW).

No scholar from the past has ever rejected this, and no one from the Salaf is ever reported to have said anything against this belief, and only scholars who deviated and made their own beliefs have opposed this belief, as this has been the traditional view of the Ahlus Sunnah.

And there is a Verse in the Holy Quran "We did not made Mankind and the Jinn except to Worship me".

And This verse is that the Living creatures which are the Mankind and the Jinn were created so that they will Worship their Lord And one important point is that this verse also needs explanation as people who quote verses without their explanation are always misguided

Ibn Tayimiyyah (rh) explained it in "كتاب درء تعارض العقل والنقل (8/480)"

“Ibn Jurayj narrated on the authority of Zayd ibn Aslam: “Except that they worship Me.” He said: He created them for misery and happiness.

And also on the authority of Wahb bin Munabbih: {Except that they worship Me} He said: He created them for obedience and created them for disobedience. Ibn Abi Hatim mentioned them both?

Accordingly, what is meant by worship is that they are subject to His judgment and decree, and that His will is effective in them.

This is what Al-Walibi narrated on the authority of Ibn Abbas, where he said: Except that they acknowledge their servitude to Me willingly or unwillingly.

Al-Tha’labi said: “If it is said: How did they disbelieve, when He created them to acknowledge His Lordship and to submit to His command and will? It is said: They submitted to His decree that He decreed upon them, because His decree is binding upon them, and they are not able to refrain from it if it descends upon them. Rather, those who disbelieved in Him disobeyed Him by doing what He commanded.

And the Saying of Sayyiduna Ibn Abbas (RA) is very clear it clearly means that this Verse means that they should submit to Allah willingly or unwillingly as they were created to Believe in Allah but deviated and went astray."

So this verse is explained that it cannot be used to refute the belief that this world was created for Rasool Allah (SAW) and if this verse was a proof against it, then why the scholars of the past never used this verse or refuted the belief? And scholars like Ibn Tayimiyyah called this belief unassailable.

Ibn Asakir narrated on the authority of Salman Farsi who said: It was said to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace: God spoke to Moses directly, created Jesus from the Holy Spirit, took Abraham as a friend, and chose Adam. What bounty have you been given? Gabriel descended and said: Your Lord says: If you have taken Abraham as a friend, then I have taken you as a beloved. If you have spoken to Moses on earth, then I have spoken to you in heaven. If you have created Jesus from the Holy Spirit, then I have created your name two thousand years before I created creation. You have trodden in heaven a place that no one has trodden before you and no one will trod after you. If you were… I have chosen Adam, and I have sealed the prophets with you. I have not created a creation more honorable to Me than you. I have given you the Pool, intercession, the she-camel, the rod, the crown, the club, the Hajj, the Umrah, the month of Ramadan, and intercession. All of this is for you, until the shade of My Throne on the Day of Resurrection is extended over you, and the crown of praise is tied upon your head. I have linked your name with My name, so I am not mentioned in any place until you are mentioned with Me. I have created the world and its people so that they may know your honor and your status with Me. Were it not for you, I would not have created the world.

And this hadith is not the only one that mentions that if it were not for you, I would not have created the world. Ibn Asakir narrated this hadith with 4 chains of transmission and all have a chain of transmission from 4 different companions of the Prophet (SAW).

And Ibn Tayimiyyah has already said that this belief is correct on the basis of such ahadith because they are supported by other narrations.

And Also Shaykh Al Islam Jalaludin Suyuti (rh) in "كتاب الخصائص الكبرى" (2/330):
"Has a Whole Chapter where he has quoted narrations from Bukhari Muslim, Musnad Ahmad and from the collections of Al Tabarani to prove this view and more than half of those narrations there are authentic and fabricated are not included there.
Sheikh Al Islam Izz al-Din Al Salam (rh) said: Among his characteristics, may God bless him and grant him peace, is that God Almighty spoke to him through three types of revelation: true visions, speech without an intermediary, and speech through Gabriel."

So if you see scholars who say or have said that this belief is wrong, then you should avoid listening to those scholars because they have deviated from the traditional opinions of the great scholars of Islam. And they have tried to say something against the unassailable Belief of Traditional Islam and Ahlus Sunnah.

link.title: The Reality of the Belief about the World being created for Rasool Allah (SAW) 💚

entry.title: A thing you won't be asked about in grave - story!
entry.content:
Here's a mini story that you should ponder over.

Muwaffaq al-Din Abu Muhammad ibn Qudamah al-Maqdisi said: Al-Suhrawardi said: I had decided to read something of the science of theology, and I was hesitant whether to read Al-Irshad by Imam al-Haramayn, or Nihayat al-Iqdam by al-Shahrastani, or the book of his Sheikh. So I went with my uncle Abu al-Najib, and he was praying next to Sheikh Abdul Qadir. He said: Sheikh Abdul Qadir turned to me and said: O Omar, this is not from the provisions of the grave, this is not from the provisions of the grave. So I went back from that, and he was informed that the Sheikh had revealed to him what was in his heart. And he forbade him from the speech that Al-Qushayri and the like were attributed to him. 

 (The Book of Straightforwardness by Ibn Tayimiyyah pg 87)

link.title: A thing you won't be asked about in grave - story!

entry.title: [Biographies of the chain of narrators of the hadith (Our Lord, God whose name is in heaven, sanctified is your name)] (3982 of Abi Dawud)
entry.content:
His saying: [Yazid bin Khalid bin Muhib Al-Ramli told us].

Yazid bin Khalid bin Mawhib Al-Ramli is trustworthy. His hadith was narrated by Abu Dawud, Al-Nasa’i and Ibn Majah.

[Al-Layth told us].

Al-Layth bin Saad Al-Masry is trustworthy. The authors of the six books cited him.

[On the authority of Ziadah bin Muhammad].

Ziyadah bin Muhammad, who may refer to Ziyad. Because the name Ziyad is the well-known avenue, unlike Ziadah, this name is unfamiliar, and the transliteration is from an unfamiliar thing to a familiar thing, such as Nabit and Thabet, so Thabit is the avenue, and Nabat is the opposite of the avenue, and Ahmad is the avenue, and I am jammed with the jim unlike the avenue, and Aba Anas is on the contrary. Other than Al-Jada, and Abu Iyas is on Al-Jada. Here, Ziadah’s name is unfamiliar and not well-known, and the famous one is Ziad.

وزيادة هذا منكر الحديث، أخرج له أبو داود والنسائي.

[On the authority of Muhammad bin Ka’b Al-Qurazi].

Muhammad bin Ka'b Al-Qurazi is trustworthy. The authors of the six books cited him.

[On the authority of Fadala].

Fadalah bin Ubaid, a companion, was narrated by Al-Bukhari in Al-Adab Al-Mufrad, Muslim and Ashab Al-Sunan.

[On the authority of Abu Darda].

Abu Al-Darda' Awimar, may God be pleased with him, and his hadith was reported by the authors of the six books.

And the chain of transmission of this hadith is actually good because the famous ones are the last ones to narrate this hadith and if there was a liar in the end then it would have been questionable and that is why scholars of hadith graded it as Hassan and there is another chain so some even considered it Sahih.

link.title: [Biographies of the chain of narrators of the hadith (Our Lord, God whose name is in heaven, sanctified is your name)] (3982 of Abi Dawud)

entry.title: The Miracle of the Holy Prophet ﷺ
entry.content:
Omar ibn Dharr reported that Abu Huraira used to say, "By Allah, there is no god but Him, I would lean my liver on the ground out of hunger, and I would put a stone on my stomach out of hunger, and I was sitting one day on the road from which they go out, when Abu Bakr passed by and I asked him about a verse from the Book of Allah. , and I asked him only to satisfy me, and he passed by and did not do so; then 'Umar passed by and I asked him about a verse from the Book of Allah, and I asked him only to satisfy me, and he passed by and did not do so; then Abu Qasim (meeans the Prophet ﷺ), may Allah bless him and grant him peace, passed by and smiled when he saw me and knew what was in my soul and in my face, and said, "Abu Hurr."I said, "Go on." He said, "Follow me." He went on, and I followed him. He went inside and asked for permission, and I was given permission. He went in and found milk in a cup. He said, "Where did this milk come from?" They said, "It was given to you by Falan or Falanah." He said, "Abu Hurr." I said, "Go to the people of the company and call them to me." He said, "Abu Hurr.He said, "The people of the company are the guests of Islam; they do not shelter in any family or wealth, or against anyone; if a charity comes to him, he sends it to them and does not take anything from it; if a gift comes to him, he sends it to them, takes some of it and shares it with them." I was offended by this and said, "What is this milk in the people of the company, I should have had the right to take some of this milk. When he came, he ordered me to give them a drink of this milk, and I would give it to them, and I would give them what I thought might reach me from this milk, but I had no choice but to obey Allah and to obey His Messenger, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, so I came to them and invited them, and they came, and they asked permission, and he gave them permission, and they took their seats in the house.I said, "I welcome you, O Messenger of Allah." He said, "Take the cup and give it to them. So I took the cup and gave it to the man and he drank until he was satisfied, then he returned the cup to me, then I gave it to the man and he drank until he was satisfied, then he returned the cup to me and he drank until he was satisfied, then he returned the cup to me and he drank until he was satisfied. Then he would return the goblet to me, until I came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and all the people had drunk. He took the goblet and placed it on his hand, looked at me, smiled, and said, "Abu Hurr."I said, "You are welcome, O Messenger of Allah." He said, "I am left with you and me." I said, "You are right, O Messenger of Allah." He said, "Sit down and drink." I sat down and drank, and he said, "Drink.I sat down and drank. He said, "Drink." He kept saying, "Drink," until I said, "No, O Messenger of Allah, who sent you in truth, I cannot find a way to it." He said, "Show me." I gave him the cup, and he praised Allah, and drank the remainder.

(Sahih-Al-Bukhari Reference number: 6542)

This is just one of the Miracles of our Prophet (SAW) and it is beautiful that what even he touches is blessed and even that small cup of milk was enough to feed more than 70 people and it was the blessing of his hand that so many drank to their fullness and yet it remained as it was. It's written Abu Hurr there because in the Hadith it was like this aswell not the full name there in the arabic version

link.title: The Miracle of the Holy Prophet ﷺ

entry.title: Explaining good and bad Bidah
entry.content:
Bid'ah Al Hasana and Bid'ah Al-Sayyi'ah

Imam Shafi's and Ahmad also narrated this hadith to explain it.
Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) also said: "Whoever introduces a good practice into Islam will have the reward for it and the reward of those who follow him in it, without being diminshed from their reward" (Sahih Muslim).

Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said: "The best of deeds are (which are innovated) as long as they are good." (Sahih al-Jami') and i found this Hadith in Jami and i also saw it in the book of Imam Al Hajjawi (RA).

And the concept of praying the tarawweh in the Mosque was also a bidah because the Prophet (ﷺ) did not do that for more than 3 days and Hadrat Umar and Hadrat Ali (RA) started it and it was a bidah ? no ? it was a Bidah aswell.

And this Tarawweh one is also recorded in Muwatta Malik when hadrat Umar (RA) told his son to pray 20 "rak'ahs" of taraweeh and Hadrat Ali (RA) was also standing close to him and he allowed it instead of stopping it so this also a bidah by the logic of a certain sect. 

And the day on which the Sahabas used to hold khutbahs and used to pray more was that no Bidah ? because the Prophet (ﷺ) never held a day like that. And Imam Ahmad (RA) said that its not bidah because the Sahaba knows more than us and what they do is right. 

And a scholar of the Salafism sect quoted the opinion of Imam Ahmad (RA) and said that it was bid'ah and he called the Imam wrong by doing that and considered his opinion correct over the opinion of the Great Imam. 

And another example that when you guys go to the school you are also doing bidah aswell And in some way you can't save yourself from Bid'ah no matter what.

And the concept of Bid'ah al-Hasanah and Al-Sayyi'ah should be very clear now.

And these Shaykhs and the Great Imams had much more knowledge than us in everything and had more hadiths available than us and if they say that there are two types of Bidah then i consider there are 2 types of it on the basis of Hadiths and Fatwas. These Great Imams and Shaykhs have also explained this concept really well.

Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal: "Bid'ah is of two types: Bid'ah al-Hasanah (good innovation) and Bid'ah al-Sayyi'ah (bad innovation). Good innovation is that which is in accordance with the Sunnah.While bad innovation is that which contradicts the Sunnah. Al Shafi also had the same view on this." (Al-Mughni)

Shaykh Al Islam Caliph of Sultan Al Awliya Ibn Qudamah (RA) : "Bid'ah is not rejected in its entirety. Rather, it is divided into good and bad. Good innovation is that which is in accordance with the principles of Islam, while bad innovation is that which contradicts those principles." (Al Mughni)

Imam Al-Buhut (RA) : "Bid'ah is an innovation in religion. If it is in accordance with the Sunnah, then it is good. If it contradicts the Sunnah, then it is bad." (Kashshaf al-Qina')

And the Fatwa of Imam-e-Azam. Imam Abu Hanifah: "Bid'ah is of two types: Bid'ah al-I'tiqadiyah (innovation in belief) and Bid'ah al-'Amaliyah (innovation in practice). Bid'ah al-I'tiqadiyah is always bad, while Bid'ah al-'Amaliyah can be good or good."

Innovations that are in accordance with the principles of Islam and serve a beneficial purpose can be considered Bid'ah al-Hasanah (good innovation). 

Innovations that contradict the Quran, Sunnah, or the teachings of the Companions are considered Bid'ah al-Sayyi'ah (bad innovation) and should be avoided.

But this doesn't mean that someone can go and add a new thing in Islam, Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said,: "Bid'ah leads to hellfire".

This hadith above about the Bad Bidah and Al Hajjawi explained it really well in two of his books when he addressed the issue of bid'ah.

Meanwhile Ibn Taymiyyah in Sirat Mustaqim
"Mawlid is a bidah but whoever celebrates it will get a great amount of Good deeds."

Ibn Taymiyyah in Majmu Fatawi vol 20 said
"Bidah which is not against the text of the Prophet (SAW) is a good bidah."

Umar (RA) said blessing of bidah
Greatest Scholars of Islam on Bid'ah Hasanah

The Great Imam Tahawi said bid'ah is divided into five parts

كتاب كشاف اصطلاحات الفنون والعلومpg 313

Imam Nawawi said good bid'ah exists in his Tabyan in Adab of Quran. 

Ibn Taymiyyah said bid'ah can be good for the Saying of Umar (RA)

Majmu Fatawi 20/163

Mulla Ali Qari also explained the concept of Bid'ah hasanah in his sharh of Mishkat al masabih by Mulla Ali Qari (rh) hadith number 1385 vol 3 pg,330.

entry.title: Explanation of the Verse of Al Fatiha.
entry.content:
"You alone we worship, You alone we ask for help"

Worship here means that we humble oursleves infront of our Lord and Help means that we Ask him for it we don't say like the Mutazilites (deviant sect) that we don't need to ask for it. 

And the Meaning of the Words is that we Worship you alone without any partner and we ask you to help us in your worship.

And this shows that there is nowhere in the explanation of it that we can't ask a doctor for help but this is rather help in worship.


The first statement was from Tafsir Tabari and this one is from the Tafsir of Imam Ibn Rajab:

We have to ask God for help because Mutazilites (deviant sect) said that we will not ask for help or guidance because we already have it. This is wrong and God dislikes such beliefs.  


In Tafsir of Imam Jalaluddin (rh) he also writes that a deviant group said we won't ask for help because we have it already but God dislikes such beliefs and such beliefs are on kufr because its the rejection of the Quran. And The Help here is also mentioned is with worship.

Imam Ibn Kathir (rh) in his tafsir uses the narration of Ibn Abbas (RA) that We worship you as one and seek help means we Obey him in all our affairs.

Making any other understanding of this verse is misguidance and explanaing it according to ones sect is also deviancy.

link.title: Explanation of the Verse of Al Fatiha.

entry.title: Explaining what is Shirk and is Istighatha Shirk ?
entry.content:
The word Shirk means that you associate someone with Allah (SWT) or you are giving the attributes of Allah to the creation.

When A Muslim recites the Shahada he purifies himself from the spiritual Impurity and Then He is away from Shirk and becomes someone who accepts that Only Allah (SWT) has all the power and no one else can do anything or bless anyone with anything unless he wants anything to happen.

And If a Man Accepts that no one has any power or is equal to Allah then he is free from shirk.

And Shirk has Two Types Shirk Akbar, Shirk asghar:

The Major Shirk is to believe and associate someone with Allah (SWT) and giving someone the power which is only for Allah and its shirk akbar.

The Shirk-Al-Asghar which is also called Minor shirk is not the unforgiveable Shirk its small and one can repent after it.

It usually happens when people think that they are wearing a stone as amulets and think they will bring good luck and doing something to show off infront of everyone and doing things for someone other than Allah count in the form of Shirk Asghar (minor Shirk)

This Shirk usually happens and people don't even realize and it is also related to ones intention aswell and if it becomes corrupt then it happens the most. 

Rasool Allah ﷺ said: “The thing that I fear most for you is minor shirk.” They said: “O Messenger of Allah, what is minor shirk?” He said: “Showing off, for Allah will say on the Day when people are recompensed for their actions: ‘Go to those for whom you were showing off with your deeds in the world, and see what reward you find with them.’ 

(Musnad Ahmad)

And The First thing about Istighatha is that you cannot ask anyone directly its clearly against the Adab and its not permissible to ask anyone to grant you anything as Dua is only for Allah and if someone directs it to anyone else then its Shirk because Dua is Worship. 

This is taken from the Siyar of Imam Dahabi (rh) and there is one thing which is very important and you must understand this,

If one does these things then its not shirk but its important to acknowledge that only Allah has the power and they can only pray for you.


And this is one of the major proofs which you have to use for such things because our beloved Prophet (SAW) asked Jibril to intercede for him but people call such things as Shirk Akbar which is wrong

(Recorded by Al Tabarani and also In Majma Zawd)
And people say that the Dead cannot hear and he cannot pray for you its wrong he indeed hears even the Prophet (SAW) used the Word "Ya" to call these disbelievers and even they could hear his blessed voice

And The Believer has more Power granted by Allah (SWT)

(Musnad Ahmad)

This is the Explanation of Death and the Soul just goes to the next realm as Imam Ahmad rh said:

And The Prophets are alive with in their graves and Our Prophet (ﷺ )is more alive than we are. And Also for the righetous servants they are also in a very awake state in their grave.



Last pic was from Kitab Ruh and this one is from it aswell.

And Imam Ibn Qayyim (rh) says this about Istighatha that a man directly asked Ibn Taymiyyah rh for guidance and he came in his dream and guided him regarding the religious matter"those who deny it are the most ignorant".


The Companions of Our Prophet (SAW) used the Slogan "Ya Muhammad Madad" during the Battle of Yamama.

(Al Bidayah of Ibn Kathir check hijri 11 musaylimah the liar section).

"Abu Hudhayfah said: ‘O people of the Qur’an, adorn the Qur’an with your deeds.’ He carried on until he was far away and his medicine was affected. Khalid ibn al-Walid carried on until he passed them, heading towards Musaylimah, hoping to reach him and kill him. Then he returned and stood between the two lines, calling for single combat, saying: ‘I am the son of al-Walid, the old one, I am the son of ‘Amir and Zayd.’ Then he called out the Muslims’ slogan - which was ‘O Muhammad’ - and no one came forward to him without being killed, and nothing approached him without being eaten."

And Shaykh Al Islam Ibn Taymiyyah rh said in Sirat Al Mustaqim:
"The Sahaba went to the Grave of the Prophet (SAW) and asked him for Rain because there was a drought and Bilal RA was present there and then they asked him for rain and also said intercede for us with your lord and bless us with rain." What the Companions did is permissible but i don't recommend it to anyone because if it doesn't happens when you ask someone then you will lose love and respect for that person.

He Further added: "Whoever Denies seeking help from the Prophet (SAW) which benefits his rank is either a deviant or a disbeliever."

And The Definiton of Gawth is seeking help and Istighatha means seeking help and seeking help through intercession or through the Dua of the Righetous is actually what Really Istighatha is if you ask them to pray for you then its Istighatha. 

This is What Shaykh Ibn Tayimiyyah said Regarding Istighatha and Tawassul (In arabic seeking help is called Istighata and seeking intercession or blessings is tawassul)

(majmu fatawi 101)


"Asking the Creation which is in its Power is permissible and seeking their Help is to seek their intercession with Allah (SWT). And anyone who asks the Creation and considers they will give other than Allah that person is an infidel."

(majmu fatawi vol 1 p,104)

Shaykh Ibn Taymiyyah (rh) has a book which is a response to Al Bakri and the thing about this is that the Edition of Majmu fatawi the Saudi edition in it there is a note that his response to Al Bakri is not an authentic one and it has been manipulated from its first copy.

The Other Fatwa of The Great Shaykh about this and asking for Help is to ask them to make Dua because Making Dua is what he (SAW) can do for you.

And Asking for anything else which is not in the Power of the Creation its Shikr Akbar and the worst sin to commit.

And Shaykh writes in Majmu Fatawi (109-110)

"Whoever denies seeking intercession through the Prophet (SAW) is an infidel and the Muslims are agreed on this." 

And The Shaykh has written again and Again that Tawassul is indeed permissible and there is no issue about that but regarding Istighata he has written again and again that We only Seek help from Allah and no one else and when we seek Help through the creation its not asking.

Them to bless us nor we consider them to bless us if anyone thinks they can bless us with something which is only for Allah then he can be declared as an Infidel."

This is about giving them Divine Power if you are giving it to them then its shirk akbar.

(Majmu fatawi)

All disciples of Ibn Taymiyyah (rh) had a view on Istighata which was positive and the first fatwa of Ibn Taymiyyah which i shared is the reason why Imam Ibn Qayyim (rh) thought that it was fine to seek guidance from him after his death.

"Only the most ignorant will deny this"




And In Masa'il Ahmad its recorded that Imam Ahmad rh directly called an angel and people call it shirk Akbar which i don't think is correct because he Said "O Servants of Allah guide me to the way" and if he said that it was because of a Hadith about it. And Imam Ahmad was right. 

And I have clearly explained that the Dead is not like the one who is ended or in pain or helpless he is in a good way and He can Go anywhere on Earth

Salman Farsi (RA) said: "The Souls are on Earth."

Imam Malik rh said: "I have been told that the souls are on Earth and can go anywhere on Earth."

(Kitab Ruh check pages till 60 for it)

And There is nothing new for the Dead he is just losing his Body and this is also a benefit for him as he can go anywhere as a Soul even where he couldn't go with his Body. 

Another Hadith on This and Allah will say "Call for your special one" you can understand the meaning quite well i think. (Hadith from Imam Ibn Al Mubarak' works authentic aswell)
And Thus Its proved that Istighatha is Permissible in light of such proofs available.

And All the Hanbalis have always called it permissible even the direct one the way Imam Ahmad did And Shafis also said its permissible and The Mailiks aswell and also the hanafis the majority agrees.

I hope this will clear any type of Confusion about Istighata its just that seeking intercession of the Righetous or ask them to make dua to Allah for you, And seeking help from the Creation in which it's able to help is permissible but one thing that making dua to others is shirk.

link.title: Explaining what is Shirk and is Istighatha Shirk ?

entry.title: What is Faith?What Power does Faith holds? The Weapon of the People of Faith is Dua (Supplication). And What is Divine Decree ?(qadr)
entry.content:
The Messenger of God, (ﷺ), said : "Whoever bears witness that there is no god except Allah, and that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His servant and sincere Messenger, will enter Paradise."
(Mujam' Al Kabir)

The Messenger of God, ﷺ, said : There is nothing more honorable to Allah than the believer.
(Majma of Al Haythami)

The Messenger of God, (ﷺ), said: The angels said: O our Lord, You have given the children of Adam the world, so they eat, drink, ride, and dress, and we glorify You with praise, and do not eat, drink, or play.

So just as you have given them the world, give us the Hereafter. He said: I will not make the offspring of one whom I have created with My hands like one to whom I said, “Be,” and he was."
(Narrated by Al Tabarani)

The Messenger of Allah (SAW) said "Actions are according to the Divine Decree, and the provision is guaranteed, and the term (of life) is fixed, and the repentance of the one who repents is accepted and the supplication of the one who supplicates is answered."
(Sahih Bukhari)

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), said, "Verily, Allah has written the destinies of all creatures fifty thousand years before He created the heavens and the earth."
(Musnad Ahmad)

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). said: "When the people of Allah are in a situation in which they despair and are sad then He Laughs at them because he knows that he will bless them and what is written for them ahead."
(Musnad Ahmad)

This is the ost important thing that brings one Faith and believeing in all of them is a must inorder to acheive Faith.

And Faith is something beautiful and strange because you must know that faith is something like believing something and if you believe.

That nothing can happen to you either good or bad unless Allah wants then it will be called Faith.

Faith should be so strong that one should believe that even he can get blasted by a bomb but won't die if Allah (SWT) wants him to live this is what you call faith.

And Our actions are free and we can do whatever we want as we have free-will but there is one thing which we can never know about that is the divine decree and our actions are if you do something but you don't know what will be the result of it and what will happen.

For example: One can throw a cup but he doesn't know for sure wether it will break into peices or survive and the action is like that we can do something but the result of our action is decided by Allah (SWT) and this is why we supplicate so that our actions get a better result.

And Dua is the Power of the Believer because Dua is something which is extremely strong.
Imam Ali (AS), said: "Dua is the weapon of the Believer."

And in another saying: "That a Muslim needs Dua more than hardwork." This is because a man will be able to do hardwork but if he doesn't make dua then he doesn't know wether he will get the full reward of his hard work or not and Dua makes it better for him.

And Imam Tajuddin Al Subki (rh) in his "taqibat Shafi" has a narration of Imam Ali (AS). "A Man was making a sound but was nowhere to be seen then Imam Ali said bring that man who is giving a speech but is not seen, And that man was brought there and he was actually in such a condition that he couldn't stand up. Then He asked Imam Ali (AS) for prayer and he first asked him if his Father his happy with him and he narrated the story and then he told him that he was happy with me. Then Imam Ali (AS) prayed Nafl (Voulantary prayer) and then after he completed it he Said:"Get Up" And that man got up and it was like that. Nothing had happened to him and he got up that he could even run, A man who couldn't stand up got in such a condition only because of him saying 'Get Up". 

And this Miraclous Act of a Wali is also about dua and his words were not his but rather the words of Allah and when a Wali speaks he doesn't speak from his mouth rather its the word of Allah and then what he says gets fulfilled.

And The meaning of Telling this Story while talking about Dua is that you Imam Ali asked him first about are your parents or father happy with you ? and when he learned about his father with whom he used to live with was happy with him then he prayed for him.

Dua is not accepted unless people are happy with you and if you are not completeting someones rights on you and if people are not happy with you then God is not happy with you and if you make the people pleased with you then God will be pleased with you and He will then answer your prayers.

And Another thing from the story of Imam Ali (AS) we learned that its a must for a Muslim to pray Nafl if he has any kind of need because they help him earn the pleasure of Allah (SWT).

And Making immidiately after praying Nafl is the most recommended act as we can see in the Story above that making Dua after Nafl is more likely to be accepted and Gets accepted Easily so Making Dua that time is the best thing to do. And The Reason why i am writing this is because Sometimes People get disappointed when their Supplication doesn't get answered and they turn away from the Deen and stop being religious. 

And If your prayer doesn't get answered then you should first see what is wrong and if there is anything in which you are wrong?

And if not then do not lose hope keep supplicating and pray more Nafl because when Dua is made with Faith its accepted then.

And those who make dua and still get disappointed are on wrong because if you don't have Faith on Allah (SWT) that he will fulfill your need (the thing you are asking for) then your Dua won't get accepted and it won't be of use because Dua without faith is not a dua.

Stay tuned for more posts!

link.title: What is Faith?What Power does Faith holds? The Weapon of the People of Faith is Dua (Supplication). And What is Divine Decree ?(qadr)

entry.title: Good reward for even planting a crop or a plant which will benefit the creation:
entry.content:
قال محمد بن حاتم وابن أبي خلف (ر): حدثنا روح، حدثنا ابن جُرَيْج، أخبرني أبو الزبير أنه سمع جابر بن عبد الله يقول: سمعت رسول الله - صلى الله عليه وسلم - يقول: "ما من رجل مسلم يغرس غرساً أو زرعاً فيأكل منه دابة أو طير أو شيء إلا كان له فيه أجر".


Muhammad ibn Hatim and Ibn Abi Khalaf (rh) said: "Ruh told us, Ibn Jurayj told us, Abu al-Zubayr told me that he heard Jabir ibn Abdullah (RA) say, 'I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) say, 'There is no Muslim man who plants a crop or a plant from which a beast, bird or thing .
eats,but he has a reward in it Ibn Abi Khalaf (rh) said: a flying thing (even flying insects).

(Sahih Muslim 1552)

Dear brothers and sisters, Even something as simple as planting can bring good rewards for the Muslim. So, if you can plant anything that will be good for any creation, like some flowers for the bees, then try to plant them. As long as it's beneficial, you will keep getting the reward.

link.title: Good reward for even planting a crop or a plant which will benefit the creation:

entry.title: Explaining that Rasool Allah ﷺ is still alive
entry.content:
Many people nowdays say that the Prophet is dead and he can't hear or see and he is not alive in his grave which is a grave sin and its kufr to say such things. And if someone lacks knowledge and says such things he is fine.

The Prophet (ﷺ) was indeed a martyr:

Imam Ibn Rajab (رحمه الله) in Fath Al Bari:

Prophet (ﷺ) said, "I have been suffering from the effects of the food that I ate at Khaybar, and I will not die until I meet my Lord as a martyr."

"The scholars are agreed that the Prophet (ﷺ) was a shaheed, because he died as a result of the effects of the poison that he was given by the Jews of Khaybar."

And if he is taking an Oath for this then its huge.
The first saying of Hadrat Umar (RA) was taken from the Sealed Nectar.

And the second narration is the proof that the Prophet (ﷺ) can hear and Umar (RA) said that he would have heard if you were standing near his blessed grave.



Imam Of the Salaf Imam Shafi said the person who says that the Prophet (ﷺ) can't hear or not alive in his grave is a kafir.

Imam Ahmad said who ever says he is dead is a kafir and Ibn Qayyim said the same.



Ibn Rajab said that the Soul of the Prophet (ﷺ ) is still with his body and he can intercede even before the day of judgment
Which means one should ask him for it.
And Ibn Tayimiyyah said whoever calls him dead is a kafir or deviant if he is not much knowledgeable about this.

And even Al Nawawi said he is alive one of the greatest is saying then then its the truth
The Incident of Harra is the biggest proof of him being alive and seeing whats happening.


The Last Hadith is the clear proof that he is still aware of everything because he said my knowledge will be the same after death

And he hears what the angels tell him so he can hear.

And In these Sahih Hadiths the Prophet (ﷺ) clearly said that i will be able to hear and see so no this is enough evidence to refute the claim of calling him unable to hear and see or helpless which is kufr.

And These Hadiths are the biggest proof of him bein able to hear, see and even he can respond to the one he wants.

Sayyidna Muhammad (ﷺ) will respond to Isa(Jesus)AS and even he will have to call him and this is just a beautiful narration and its insane to think about this.


And the Hadith about whoever sends Salawat near my grave then i will hear it myself means he can hear and if someone says he can't its deviancy and kufr.


And This is why every scholar like even Sultan Al Awliya said ask for intercession when you visit his Rawdah Mubarak.

And the Prophet (ﷺ) indeed met his lord as a martyr and still his rank was above those who get martyred because he is the reason why Earth was created as He said himself.
And the Ranks of Prophets is higher than Martyrs and even Awliya will have a rank even higher than prophets.


The Souls of the Prophet (ﷺ) is still with him and the souls of the Prophets are with them and earth cannot consume them as its mentioned in Hadiths aswell.

And Now about the explanation of the words of Hadrat Abu Bakar (RA) from the book of Imam Ibn Rajab (RA).

And the statement of Hadrat Abu Bakar (RA) had this reason behind this and he recited that verse because of some context which people who use his saying don't know about.

link.title: Explaining that Rasool Allah ﷺ is still alive

entry.title: The Reality of the Belief of the Prophet (SAW)' Noor (Light) being created before the Pen and everything else:
entry.content:
Abu Uthman Saeed bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Ibrahim Al-Adl told us (Trustworthy) , he said : Abu Al-Hasan Muhammad bin Mansour Al-Wa’iz told us (not known much) , he said: Abu Amr Muhammad bin Abdul Wahid Al-Zahid told us (Trustworthy) , he said: Muhammad bin Yunus Al-Kadimi told us (Not strong so weak) , he said: Ubaidullah bin A’ishah told us (Trustworthy) , he said: Hammad bin Salamah told us (Trustworthy) , on the authority of Thabit (Trusthworthy) , on the authority of Anas - may God be pleased with him - he said:

The Messenger of God - may God bless him and grant him peace - said: “God Almighty created me from light and created Abu Bakr from my light, and created Umar and A’ishah from the light of Abu Bakr, and created the believing men of my nation from the light of Umar, [and created the believing women of my nation from the light of A’ishah]. So whoever does not love me and does not love Abu Bakr and Umar And Aisha, he has no light, so the following was revealed to him :
“And he for whom Allah does not appoint light - for him there is no light.”

and in other Hadiths :
“I was a light in the hands of my Lord fourteen thousand years before the creation of Adam . ”

In Another hadith: “When God Almighty created Adam, He made that light revolve in his back, so it would shine in his forehead, and it would overpower the rest of his light.”

''He used to pray a lot that God Almighty would make all of his senses, limbs, and body light, to show that this would happen.''

Ibn Hajar Al Haythami said:

”What supports the fact that he - may God bless him and grant him peace - became light is that when he walked in the sun or moon, no shadow would appear to him, because it only appears to dense things. God distinguished him - may God bless him and grant him peace - from all other bodily densities, and made him pure light, from which no shadow would appear at all, in violation of the norm, just as a hole was made in the cleft of his chest and heart, and he was not affected by that.”

And in many Narrations its narrated that he his Light was created and in some we have read that the Light was added inside Adam (AS) and it kept going from one Prophet to another till our Prophet (SAW) was born.

And when the Mother of Our Prophet (SAW) was pregneant she saw Light appearing which illuminated the east and the west and she saw brightest of Light
And this is narrated in a very authentic narration (Musnad Ahmad) so this belief that his Light was Created before Adam (AS) is true and this story is actually supporting the view that his Light was something which was created even before the Pen or the Throne as in some narrations its recorded even in one authentic narration (in Al Bazzar and Musnad Ahmad and some in Musnad Abu Ya'la with good isnads not weak ones).

And this Belief is not like that he is not A Human its rather that his Light was created by Allah (SWT) and its a special thing and it was added inside Adam (AS) and then was with everyone (Descendants of our Prophet SAW) till our Prophet (SAW) came to this World so this is how this Light is not that he is not a Human because that belief of not being human will take one away from the Truth and will end up getting on kufr (Not gonna happen if someone doesn't adds divinity).

And In Many Tafsirs the Scholars of the Tafsir have used the Hadith which i quoted at the top of the message,
Like Imam Al Qurtubi (rh) and other Scholars have quoted that one aswell in their tafsirs but some scholars call it weak and it is also with another chain of transmission and that isnad is from Abu Hurayah (RA) and it is also without fabricators in the insad.

And Scholars throughout History have been using the Hadiths of his Noor Being created even before Adam (AS) for example Imam Ibn Rajab used these narrations in Lati'f Mar'if (74) and said: "There is reality in these Narrations as they are proved by other similar narrations."

And one of the Greatest of Scholars Imam Al Baghawi (rh) even he used the Hadith (which i used above) and considered it fine to use and in his tafsir he says the same that he is created from The Light as his Soul was even before Adam (AS)

And the Scholars of the Ahlus Sunnah have been using this Belief since years that the Prophet (SAW)' Noor was created before Adam (AS) and it was added inside him and thus our Prophet (SAW) is special not like other Ordinary Humans like HE (SAW) did not even had a Shadow but we have it and even in Night it was as he was shining bright so such stories about our Prophet (SAW) confirm such beliefs rather than rejecting them.

And one intresting thing which Imam Suyuti (rh) mentioned in his fatwa:

"As it is mentioned in Narrations that the Light of the Prophet (SAW) was contained in a jewel and when it was taken out that Jewel turned into a grain of rice. And this is why its recommended to send more Salawat upon the Prophet (SAW) while eating rice."
(2/50)

In the Holy Quran in Surah Nur its stated:
"Allah is the Light of the Heavens and O Prophet you are his Light on the Earth." (This is how a group of the Companions used to recite this verse tafsir tabari)

And The Light here meant that He is the One through whom Allah guides his people.

Ibn Hajar Al Haythami (rh) explained the saying of Imam Al Busiri (rh):

“Every virtue in the worlds is from the virtue of the Prophet, which the virtuous have borrowed . ”

“Every virtue found in the worlds of mankind, angels and jinn is due to the virtue of that most honorable prophet to his Lord, from all the prophets and messengers, and the angels brought near. The virtuous ones borrowed it because he - may God bless him and grant him peace - is the one who extends it to them, since he is the one through which we reach the divine, and the He is the one who derives it without an intermediary, without anyone else.“

And he further added:

“Those who carried him in their Loins got a sign of his Light, inside them it was as if it was the Sun and they derived from that Light as the Planets do. The Creations followed one another until the time of the emergence of his noble body, and when he emerged he was like the sun, and every light was included in his blessed Personality, and every sign of other prophets was folded under the spread of his signs.“
(Sharh Al Burda 36)

And the authentic narrations in Al Bidayah of Ibn Kathir (rh):

"That every Prophet and all the descendants of our Prophet (SAW) were extremely Beautiful and Handsome Men of their time and All had bright and shining faces as if it was a light shining in their faces and the Father of our Prophet (SAW) whenever he used to walk through the Streets of Mecca there would be a pleaseant smell that would remain at the place which he used to pass from."

And this saying of Ibn Kathir is based on historical evidence and its proved that the Light which Allah (SWT) created was carried from Prophets until the Birth of our Beloved Prophet (SAW).
